info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Broome, western Delaware, northeastern Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sherman, or near Deposit, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hancock, Lanesboro, Starrucca, Hiawatha, Starlight, Sherman, Winterdale, Preston Park, Hale Eddy and Scott Center. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 near 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New York.
